Posts.Content: my lovely friend was diagnosed 11 years ago she has it all over now she is still enjoying life
Posts.Title: My sister. needs postive messages from people who are in the same...

Posts.Content: Yes, and it was calcium deposits they could see
Posts.Title: Mammogram recall

Posts.Content: They should take the chemo if they really wanna know how i feel.
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Macmillan is not what i thought it was. Its a business to raise money whoever it insults or offends. The fact that brave rhyme with shave is a good marketing ploy but a very insensitive one. People objected last year so you think they would pull it  but it gets them lots of money so they don't care who gets hurt
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: They will keep on for as long as the money stops rolling in. They KNOW people are offended, they knew last year
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: I agree they should take the bloody chemo see how that feels. I don't know who thinks up these hurtful and blinkered campaigns there was one last year asking about what support you get, not from macmillan I don't know what it achieved except to make people with no support feel rubbish
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: I hate them they make me fear my own mortally. They are insensitive and could have devastating effect on sufferers. MacMillan don't care about the effect on us as it brings the money in. We have been objecting since the last lots of adverts however they're still on there.
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: They should try the Chemo that would give an insight to our lives
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Ive been objecting for the last two years so have other but they make loads of money off all of us,  they know we dont like it but they dont care. Cancer is big business a big money making scheme
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Money isn't everything They know people don't like it and yet here we are 2 years on and they dont' care. Cancer is big business they actually don't want a cure. There are other ways to raise money without using baldy kids and women. Trillions of money donated still no cure. They cant cure us because its such a money spinner for drug companies  Those adverts are horrible and unnecessary and upset me every time. You watch telly for pleasure and being reminded of your impending demise doesn't feel pleasurable. Joanie x
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: I thought that Macmillan nurses were a great charity until i needed one and found they don't cover the whole of the UK. Its a money making business, thats why they don't care how people feel about ad campaigns it brings in the cash. I have never met another cancer sufferer who wanted their friend to shave their heads.
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?
